edu.rit.util

Class Packing

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.Packing

  • public class Packing
extends Object
    Class Packing provides static methods for packing and unpacking arrays of bytes, short integers, and integers into and out of short integers, integers, long integers, and arrays thereof.

    Note: The operations in class Packing are not multiple thread safe.

    • Method Detail

      • packShortLittleEndian

        public static short packShortLittleEndian(byte[] src,
                          int srcPos)
        Pack bytes from the given array into a short integer in little-endian order.
        Parameters:
        src - Source array of bytes to pack.
        srcPos - Index of first byte to pack.
        Returns:
        Elements src[srcPos] through src[srcPos+1] packed into a short integer in little-endian order.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if src is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if packing would cause accessing array elements out of bounds.

      • packShortBigEndian

        public static short packShortBigEndian(byte[] src,
                       int srcPos)
        Pack bytes from the given array into a short integer in big-endian order.
        Parameters:
        src - Source array of bytes to pack.
        srcPos - Index of first byte to pack.
        Returns:
        Elements src[srcPos] through src[srcPos+1] packed into a short integer in big-endian order.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if src is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if packing would cause accessing array elements out of bounds.

      • packShortLittleEndian

        public static void packShortLittleEndian(byte[] src,
                         int srcPos,
                         short[] dst,
                         int dstPos,
                         int len)
        Pack bytes from the given array into the given array of short integers in little-endian order. Elements src[srcPos] through src[srcPos+2*len-1] are packed into dst[dstPos] through dst[dstPos+len-1].
        Parameters:
        src - Source array of bytes to pack.
        srcPos - Index of first byte to pack.
        dst - Destination array of packed short integers.
        dstPos - Index of first packed short integer.
        len - Number of short integers (not bytes!) to pack.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if src is null. Thrown if dst is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if packing would cause accessing array elements out of bounds; in this case dst is not altered.

      • packShortBigEndian

        public static void packShortBigEndian(byte[] src,
                      int srcPos,
                      short[] dst,
                      int dstPos,
                      int len)
        Pack bytes from the given array into the given array of short integers in big-endian order. Elements src[srcPos] through src[srcPos+2*len-1] are packed into dst[dstPos] through dst[dstPos+len-1].
        Parameters:
        src - Source array of bytes to pack.
        srcPos - Index of first byte to pack.
        dst - Destination array of packed short integers.
        dstPos - Index of first packed integer.
        len - Number of short integers (not bytes!) to pack.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if src is null. Thrown if dst is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if packing would cause accessing array elements out of bounds; in this case dst is not altered.

        Pack bytes from the given array into an integer in little-endian order.

        Throws:

        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if packing would cause accessing array elements out of bounds.

      • packIntLittleEndian

        public static void packIntLittleEndian(byte[] src,
                       int srcPos,
                       int[] dst,
                       int dstPos,
                       int len)
        Pack bytes from the given array into the given array of integers in little-endian order. Elements src[srcPos] through src[srcPos+4*len-1] are packed into dst[dstPos] through dst[dstPos+len-1].
        Parameters:
        src - Source array of bytes to pack.
        srcPos - Index of first byte to pack.
        dst - Destination array of packed integers.
        dstPos - Index of first packed integer.
        len - Number of integers (not bytes!) to pack.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if src is null. Thrown if dst is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if packing would cause accessing array elements out of bounds; in this case dst is not altered.

      • unpackShortLittleEndian

        public static void unpackShortLittleEndian(short src,
                           byte[] dst,
                           int dstPos)
        Unpack the given short integer into the given array of bytes in little-endian order. The short integer is unpacked into elements dst[dstPos] through dst[dstPos+1].
        Parameters:
        src - Source short integer to unpack.
        dst - Destination array to receive unpacked bytes.
        dstPos - Index of first unpacked byte.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if dst is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if unpacking would cause accessing array elements out of bounds; in this case dst is not altered.

      • unpackShortBigEndian

        public static void unpackShortBigEndian(short src,
                        byte[] dst,
                        int dstPos)
        Unpack the given short integer into the given array of bytes in big-endian order. The short integer is unpacked into elements dst[dstPos] through dst[dstPos+1].
        Parameters:
        src - Source short integer to unpack.
        dst - Destination array to receive unpacked bytes.
        dstPos - Index of first unpacked byte.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if dst is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if unpacking would cause accessing array elements out of bounds; in this case dst is not altered.

      • unpackShortLittleEndian

        public static void unpackShortLittleEndian(short[] src,
                           int srcPos,
                           byte[] dst,
                           int dstPos,
                           int len)
        Unpack short integers from the given array into the given array of bytes in little-endian order. Elements src[srcPos] through src[srcPos+len-1] are unpacked into dst[dstPos] through dst[dstPos+2*len-1].
        Parameters:
        src - Source array of short integers to unpack.
        srcPos - Index of first short integer to unpack.
        dst - Destination array to receive unpacked bytes.
        dstPos - Index of first unpacked byte.
        len - Number of short integers (not bytes!) to unpack.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if src is null. Thrown if dst is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if unpacking would cause accessing array elements out of bounds; in this case dst is not altered.
